summary.line1: 『   Meet the needs of the vulnerable groups by

line1.prefix: We are concerned about the needs of
line1.suffix: We believe that the development of society should not forget or ignore vulnerable groups

line2.prefix: We believe that the development of technology should with humanity care. We believe that the application of
line2.suffix: can bring new solutions to vulnerable groups

line3.strong: a universal approach to solving problems.
line3.suffix: Based on technological innovation, we develop, introduce and disseminate relevant technical solutions in a universal way and apply them to specific issues of vulnerable groups.

step1.line1: Launched the project through  Crowdfunding in Tencent Foundation.
step1.line2: 30 cases of  requiring prosthetic help were collected through various channels.

step2.line1: Launched project documentary and reached more than 100,000 views
step2.line2: based on the 3D printing prosthetic open source community e-NABLE, we create the first prosthetic model improved the first version of the robot model.

steps.step3: Held three prosthetic hands making workshops in Beijing, Shanghai and Guangzhou for the first time. More than 100 volunteers participated in the production of 16  prostheses and delivered them to the disable children in demend.

step4.line1: Set up a core operation team to set up plans for prosthetic model research, volunteer network building, prosthetic designer management, online platform management, and workshop holiding.
step4.line2: The project is located in Tsinghua X-lab and operated in the form of a social enterprise.

step5.line1: Established the cooperation with AIESEC, the prosthetic production workshop had been extended to Shenzhen, Wuhan, Harbin, Guangzhou, Beijing, Suzhou and other cities.
step5.line2: In the same time, we developed the prosthetic models for more disability cases.

step6.line1: The Hands On Project was invited as a technology + charity representative to participate in Tencent's “99 Public Welfare Day” and Tencent Public Welfare Market. Tencent and the Hands On shot a public welfare special propaganda films, which were released on the 99 public welfare day homepage recommended location. The amount of exposures exceeds to 16 million.

step7.line1: Hands On won the China Youth Championship of the “Youth Co-Lab Dialogue” Challenge organized by the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP), and finally participated in the Asia Pacific Finals on behalf of China and won the “Asia Pacific Youth Sustainable Development Innovation Award”.

step8.line1: the Hands On won the Bronze Award of the first “Chinanext Yicai social innovation award”

step9.line1: Tech For Good, a sub-project of the Hands On project, and the Tencent Social Ads Algorithm Competition jointly held a hackathon with the core theme of “AI helps to find children who lost across the ages”, and was highly praised by participants and nonprofit organizations.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.question1: 1. Do you only help children? What about adults?
faq.answer1: Our current mechanical prosthetic (Cyborg Beast) is designed primarily for children, so it will be more targeted to help young children and children aged 3-14. Prosthetics are also suitable for adults. And we are also developing a more artificial appearance, more synthetic prosthetic products for adults in the same time (such as Flexy Hand).
faq.question2: 2. What function can you achieve with this prosthetic? What practical help is there for children?

answer2.main: Our mechanical prosthesis mainly achieves the grip function. 3D printing mechanical as a hand assist tool, not to fully realize the real hand function. However, for children with hand disability, the meaning of our prosthetic body is mainly reflected in:
answer2.list1: Scene-style hands with activities in life
answer2.list2: Exercise the residual muscles of the hand and promote normal development
answer2.list3: Turning "using hands" into a less frustrating learning process, reducing anxiety when children hands can't match, helps them to grow mentally.

faq.question3: 3. How is your prosthetic limb different from other prosthetic limbs on the market?

answer3.main: The existing prosthetic products on the market are not suitable for children from cost, shape, function, weight, etc. We have made 3D printing mechanical prostheses:
answer3.list1: Main components 3D printing, low production costs
answer3.list2: Mechanical transmission, easy changing and updating
answer3.list4: Simple to make, there is no production threshold for Jintong people, suitable for widespread use

faq.answer4: The prosthetic limbs that the prosthetic children need to apply through the Hands on Plan are free.
faq.question5: 5. There are a lot of robotic prosthetic like prosthetic using high-level brain waves. Do you want to try it?
faq.answer5: Our project does not focus on the development of sophisticated technology, but focuses on the technology that is designed to solve the problems that most people encounter.
faq.question6: 6. What disability does your product apply to?

answer6.line1: For hand disability, we are currently divided into three main hand types: short finger, reserved carpal bone, no carpal bone.
answer6.line2: For the three hand types, we will develop the prosthetic limb, hands and arms separately. The current model of all prosthetic limbs will be based on the model on the open source prosthetic community e-NABLE (http://enablingthefuture.org).

question7.title: 7. I want to learn how to make such a prosthetic to help others. How can I do this?

faq.answer7: We are building a network of designer volunteers, and friends who have experience in 3D printing/3D modeling are welcome to register via the website or our WeChat public account (wow3dhand). After the designer has signed up, you need to write to the entry task. After completing the entry task and passing the assessment, you can refer to question 8 to choose the work that suits you.

answer8.main: Under the premise of completing the entry task, there are four types of work to choose from, you can choose more:

list1.title: 1.Volunteer designer
list1.line1: Designers with strong capabilities and 3D print resources, we will directly match a recipient to assist with data collection and communication, and the designer will solve the specific case independently.
list1.line2: ＜Designer's work＞ Communicate with the recipients and design the model independently based on the data. (You can design it yourself or refer to the model developed by others, and print and assemble the prosthetic well to send it to the recipient.)

list2.title: 2.Model R&D Designer
list2.line1: We assist and organize designers to conduct model development and side-tests based on the three situations mentioned above, and print service support will be provided by cooperating 3D printing companies.
list2.line2: ＜Designer's work＞ Based on three basic situations, select the types of interest that you are interested in, and our core technology members will work with you. We provide 3D printing service support.

list3.title: 3.Workshop supporter
list3.line1: In each workshop, we will select a number of people with similar disability (adapted to the same model) from each of the recipients. Each designer assigns 1-3 recipients as appropriate, and tests the model matching based on the measured data. And make certain adjustments to ensure that the prosthetic assembled by the volunteers in the workshop are suitable for the recipients, and the cooperation service will be provided by the cooperating 3D printing company.
list3.line2: ＜Designer's work＞ Based on the assigned recipient data and the basic model, try to make 1-2 hand wells to make some fine adjustments to the model, adjust the print ratio to ensure that it is suitable for the recipients. And distributed to the workshop and assembled by volunteers.

list4.title: 4. Education Product Supporter
list4.line1: According to the specific educational product design, the main work of the supporter will be to provide students with online guidance for a certain period of time to help students learn the production of mechanical prosthetics and help specific recipients.

answer8.list5: PS. In addition to the volunteer designers, the other three types of designers will receive subsidies based on the operation of the project.

faq.question9: 9. I want to help, but I don't have the relevant professional skills. How can I contribute?
faq.answer9: If you have someone who needs help, please submit a help application on our website or WeChat public account (wow3dhand), we will process and provide free help. If you have other resources (3D printing, demand side looking for channels, media, prosthetic R&D, etc.), we hope you can follow us on WeChat public account and leave us a message.
